{"step_by_step_thinking": "Hypereosinophilic syndrome is a rare disorder characterized by a high number of eosinophils in the blood. The eosinophil count is a key factor in diagnosing this condition. According to the World Health Organization, the eosinophil count should be greater than 1500/mm3 for at least six months for a diagnosis of hypereosinophilic syndrome.", "answer_choice": "C. >1500/ mm3"}
